meanings.sent1: She carefully excides the unwanted parts from the paper.
meanings.sent2: The surgeon excides the tumor to save the patient's life.
meanings.sent3: The chef excides the burnt edges of the toast, leaving only the golden center.
meanings.sent4: With precision, the sculptor excides the excess marble to reveal the masterpiece within.
meanings.sent5: The gardener excides the dead branches to allow new growth to flourish.

meanings.sent1: His dedication excides all others in the competition.
meanings.sent2: The student excides in mathematics, always solving problems quickly.
meanings.sent3: The athlete excides his own record, impressing everyone with his speed.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness excides any expectations, making her a beloved friend to all.
meanings.sent5: The singer's voice excides all others, captivating the audience with its beauty.
